text: I thought about this some more and think that APE might not be so bad to compute if the background stratification is constant.  Not sure fi that is the case here?  In this case, the PE is the integral of g \rho z over the volume.  Using the evolution equation for the buoyancy, and some algebra, I believe you can find that the APE is equal to something proportional to \rho'^2.  It would be nice to do this for general stratifications but that would be harder.  But I think that this is something for another day and I will create an issue for it.

text: to compute APE in a setup like this you have to sort the buoyancy field, taking into account the immersed boundary, which could be a bit annoying. If you have a constant stratification N^2 and perturbations are small, you can approximate it with b^2 / (2 * N^2).
